stage_0_react_migration.conversation_reference: Detailed Stage 0 planning for React frontend architecture migration

stage_overview.content: Foundation stage to migrate from Django templates to React SPA with internal DRF APIs
stage_overview.strategic_importance: Enables all future UI development including sophisticated batch editing features
stage_overview.completion_criteria: React infrastructure ready for Stage 1 batch editing development

react_spa_setup.content: Single Page Application with React Router handling all frontend routing
react_spa_setup.routing_approach: React Router handles all client-side routing (/catalog/, /collaborators/, etc.)
react_spa_setup.django_integration: Django serves React build files and catches unmatched URLs to serve React app
react_spa_setup.url_handling: Proper SPA behavior with direct URL access and browser refresh support

technology_stack.content: FOSS, well-maintained packages prioritizing spreadsheet-like UX capabilities
technology_stack.state_management: Redux Toolkit or Zustand for complex spreadsheet state management
technology_stack.ui_components: Material-UI or similar FOSS library with clean layouts
technology_stack.spreadsheet_focus: Components must support Google Sheets-style UX for batch editing
technology_stack.build_integration: Standard React build process integrated with Django static files

api_design_principles.content: Separate internal DRF APIs for full CRUD operations distinct from public read-only APIs
api_design_principles.endpoint_structure: /internal/v1/ for internal APIs, /api/v1/ remains for public APIs
api_design_principles.use_case_separation: Internal APIs serve React frontend with full CRUD, public APIs serve external applications with read-only access
api_design_principles.authentication: Session-based authentication leveraging existing Django auth system
api_design_principles.permission_integration: Uses existing permission classes (Admin, Archivist, Museum Staff, Read-only)

serializer_strategy.content: Separate internal serializers not extending public ones due to different use cases
serializer_strategy.rationale: Internal serializers need full field access, public serializers need filtered fields - extension would mean 'include all the rest'
serializer_strategy.validation_approach: Extract existing validation logic from Django forms for reuse in DRF serializers
serializer_strategy.complex_field_handling: DRF serializers handle M2M and FK relationships needed for smart spreadsheet cells
serializer_strategy.json_serialization: Proper JSON handling for machine-readable cell data storage

session_based_auth.content: React frontend authenticates via Django sessions, maintaining existing permission system
session_based_auth.implementation: Session-based authentication for React→Django API calls
session_based_auth.csrf_protection: Automatic CSRF protection through Django's session system
session_based_auth.permission_classes: Existing Django groups (Admin, Archivist, Museum Staff, Read-only) used for internal API authorization
session_based_auth.user_context: React frontend receives user context and permissions from Django session

parallel_development.content: Django templates remain functional during React development for fallback and reference
parallel_development.coexistence_approach: Django templates exist as orphaned code until React frontend is complete
parallel_development.url_transition: Clean switch by updating Django URL patterns to serve React SPA when ready
parallel_development.code_cleanup: Delete Django frontend code (templates, template views, forms) after React transition is complete
parallel_development.user_transition: Clean switch for users - no parallel systems, rapid development phase allows UX changes

django_template_features.content: Comprehensive capture of all existing Django template functionality in React SPA
core_crud_operations: Individual object creation (Add new Item, Collection, Collaborator, etc.)
Individual object editing with inline field editing UX
Bulk operations where they currently exist
search_and_filtering: Model-specific search interfaces (Items, Collections, Collaborators, Languoids)
Filter combinations (e.g., by collection + language + access level)
list_and_detail_views: Detailed object views with all metadata

inline_editing_ux.content: Modern inline editing approach for individual object CRUD operations
inline_editing_ux.design_pattern: Detail view with click-to-edit fields rather than separate edit forms
user_experience: Click on any editable field in detail view to enter edit mode
Save/cancel options per field or save all changes
technical_implementation: React components that toggle between display and edit modes
Field-level API updates for efficient saves
Optimistic updates with rollback on error
Real-time validation using DRF serializer validation
inline_editing_ux.benefits: More efficient than separate edit pages, better UX for quick edits, maintains context

milestone_1.title: React Infrastructure Setup
deliverables: Build integration with Django static files

milestone_2.title: Internal API Foundation
deliverables: Full CRUD serializers for all core models (Items, Collections, Collaborators, Languoids)
Field-level update endpoints for inline editing
Permission integration with existing Django groups

milestone_3.title: Core CRUD Components
deliverables: List views with search/filtering for all models
Detail views with inline editing capability

milestone_4.title: Advanced Features & Spreadsheet Foundation
deliverables: Spreadsheet-like component foundation for batch editing

performance_considerations.content: Architecture must support large datasets for spreadsheet-style interfaces
performance_considerations.data_handling: Efficient state management for hundreds of rows with complex field types
performance_considerations.api_optimization: Pagination and filtering support for large model datasets
performance_considerations.client_performance: Virtual scrolling or similar techniques for large spreadsheet views

stage_completion.content: Stage 0 complete when React infrastructure can support sophisticated batch editing features
completion_indicators: React SPA serves all main application routes
Internal DRF APIs provide full CRUD for all models (Items, Collections, Collaborators, Languoids)
All existing Django template functionality preserved and enhanced
Inline editing works for individual object fields
Search and filtering functionality matches or exceeds current capabilities
List views with pagination, sorting, and filtering
Detail views with comprehensive object information
Add/delete operations with proper confirmation workflows
Complex field types (M2M, FK) properly serialized and handled
Spreadsheet-like components ready for smart cell implementation
Performance adequate for large dataset manipulation
stage_completion.readiness_for_stage_1: Can begin implementing smart spreadsheet batch editing features
